com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.controller.components

Class RailPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.controller.components.RailPath

  • public class RailPath
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a series of points along which a minecart moves over the rails. The points of this path are relative to the (0,0,0) of the rails block. Paths are immutable to enable optimized performance for simple (two-point) paths.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RailPath.Builder
      Builder for paths, which makes it easier to compose paths consisting of multiple points.
      static class  RailPath.Point
      A single point on the path
      static class  RailPath.Position
      Stores all the transformation information for a single position on the path.
      static class  RailPath.Segment
      A linear segment between two points

      • getStartPosition

        public RailPath.Position getStartPosition()
        Gets the start position of this rail path. This is the final position at the start of the first segment of this path.
        Returns:
        start position

      • getEndPosition

        public RailPath.Position getEndPosition()
        Gets the end position of this rail path. This is the final position at the end of the last segment of this path.
        Returns:
        end position

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Gets whether this Rail Path is empty. An empty rail path offers no point information, essentially allowing free movement through the space. This is the case when the number of segments is 0.
        Returns:
        True if empty

      • distanceSquared

        public double distanceSquared(org.bukkit.util.Vector position)
        Finds the distance squared between a rail-relative position and this rail path. Returns Double.MAX_VALUE if this path has no segments.
        Parameters:
        position - (relative)
        Returns:
        distance squared between the position and this rail path

      • findSegment

        public RailPath.Segment findSegment(org.bukkit.util.Vector position)
        Finds the segment of this rail path that is used at the relative position specified
        Parameters:
        position - (relative to rails block)
        Returns:
        segment, null if this rail path has no segments

      • findSegment

        public RailPath.Segment findSegment(org.bukkit.util.Vector position,
                                    org.bukkit.block.Block rails)
        Finds the segment of this rail path that is used at the absolute position specified
        Parameters:
        position - (absolute)
        rails - (relative to which this path exists)
        Returns:
        segment, null if this rail path has no segments

      • snap

        public void snap(RailPath.Position position,
                 org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Snaps onto this rail path. The input position information is updated to be on this path. This snap function allows absolute position calculations, by also specifying the rails block.
        Parameters:
        position - in relative or absolute world coordinates
        railsBlock - relative to which this path is

      • move

        public double move(RailState state,
                   double distance)
        Moves along this rail path for a certain distance. The input rail state information is updated with the movement. A movement distance of 0 can be used to snap the minecart onto the path. A return distance of 0.0 indicates that the end of the path was reached.
        Parameters:
        state - with rail position, direction and block information
        distance - to move
        Returns:
        actual distance moved. Can be less than distance if the end of the path is reached.

      • move

        public double move(RailPath.Position position,
                   org.bukkit.block.Block railBlock,
                   double distance)
        Moves along this rail path for a certain distance. The input position information is updated with the movement. A movement distance of 0 can be used to snap the minecart onto the path. A return distance of 0.0 indicates that the end of the path was reached. This move function allows absolute position calculations, by also specifying the rails block.
        Parameters:
        position - in absolute world coordinates
        railBlock - relative to which is moved
        distance - to move
        Returns:
        actual distance moved. Can be less than distance if the end of the path is reached.

      • move

public double move(org.bukkit.util.Vector position,
                                org.bukkit.util.Vector direction,
                                org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                double distance)

public double moveRelative(org.bukkit.util.Vector position,
                                        org.bukkit.util.Vector direction,
                                        double distance)
        Deprecated. 

      • moveRelative

        public double moveRelative(RailPath.Position position,
                           double distance)
        Moves along this rail path for a certain distance. The input position information is updated with the movement. A movement distance of 0 can be used to snap the minecart onto the path. A return distance of 0.0 indicates that the end of the path was reached. This move function allows relative position calculations; the positions are relative to the rails.
        Parameters:
        position - in rail-relative coordinates
        distance - to move
        Returns:
        actual distance moved. Can be less than distance if the end of the path is reached.

      • create

        public static RailPath create(org.bukkit.util.Vector... pointVectors)

      • create

        public static RailPath create(RailPath.Point... points)

      • offset

        public static RailPath offset(RailPath original_path,
                              org.bukkit.util.Vector position_offset)
        Takes a rail path and translates its position based on a vector offset. The up vectors of the original path are left unaffected.
        Parameters:
        original_path - to offset
        position_offset - to offset
        Returns:
        original rail path offset by the position offset
